text:
Hester Street, north side, east from Essex to Suffolk Streets. Note the flag of P.S. No. 75 (Norfolk Street, west side, north of Hester) across the roofs. To-day (1937) this has been replaced by P.S. No. 62, which also occupies the sites of buildings in the foreground. No. 41 Hester Street, is a 3-story frame house with a brick front.

About 1905.

Ewing Galloway.

Hester Street, north side, east from Essex to Suffolk Streets. Note No. 41; a 3-story frame house with a brick front. Buildings between Essex and Norfolk Streets, have been replaced by P.S. No. 62.

About 1905.

Ewing Galloway.

27 and 29 Essex Street, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of Hester Street.

About 1926.

W. B. Vernam.

30 Essex Street, East side, and north east corner and Hester Street, showing P.S. 62, also known as Seeward Park High School.

Board of Education, N.Y.C.

July 29, 1929.

39 Hester Street, and North east corner of Essex Street, between Norfolk Streets, showing P.S. 62. Also known as Seward Park High School.

Board of Education, N.Y.C,
July 29, 1929.

Essex Street, east side, north of Hester Street.
February 14, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.

31 to 1 Essex Street, west side, from north of Hester to and including Canal Streets. The view also shows 2-16 Rutgers Street, west side, from Canal to Henry Streets. The St. Teresa Roman Catholic Church is in the background in Henry Street. The view also shows 163-175 East Broadway, at, adjoining and east of the S.E. corner of Rutgers Street.

April 20, 1931.

P.L. Sperr.

(1)
Essex Street, east side, from but not including Hester Street, to Essex Market place.
About March 15, 1934.

P.L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, slightly more inclusive. Note the Ave. B surface car.
April 20, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Essex Street, east side, from but not including Hester Street, to Essex Market place.
About March 15, 1934.

P.L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, slightly more inclusive. Note the Ave. B surface car.
April 20, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

23-27 Essex Street, west side, at Hester Street.
January 16, 1931.

P.L. Sperr.

(1)
Essex Street, west side, from No. 33, north of Hester Street to and including Canal Street.

April 20, 1931.

P.L. Sperr.
Ney 4700

(2)

April 20, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Essex Street, west side, from No. 33, north of Hester Street to and including Canal Street.

Ney 4700

April 20, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Hester Street, from and including Esses (left), to, but not including Suffolk Streets (right), as seen from Seward Park. The park is on the south side, while subway construction (Independent System Eighth Ave)., is on the north. Across the latter, appears the new Seward Park High School on Grand Street. Shown across the background is Essex Street, west side, north from Hester to Grand Streets.

April 20, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A portion of the same, showing truck entering subway entrance at the N.W. corner of Norfolk Street. Hester Street is on the extreme left. Buildings in the background are on Essex Street.

April 20, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Hester Street, from and including Esses (left), to, but not including Suffolk Streets (right), as seen from Seward Park. The park is on the south side, while subway construction (Independent System Eighth Ave)., is on the north. Across the latter, appears the new Seward Park High School on Grand Street. Shown across the background is Essex Street, west side, north from Hester to Grand Streets.

April 20, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A portion of the same, showing truck entering subway entrance at the N.W. corner of Norfolk Street. Hester Street is on the extreme left. Buildings in the background are on Essex Street.

April 20, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

44-48 Hester Street; south side, between Essex and Ludlow Streets. Nos. 46-48 Hester Street, are 3-story frame buildings with brick fronts.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

Essex Street, west side, from and including Hester Street to but not including Essex Market Place.

March 14, 1934.

P.L. Sperr.

Essex Street, east side, north from and including Hester Street.
March 30, 1934.

Hester Street.

25 Essex Street, west side, at the S.W. corner of Hester Street.
March 30, 1934.

P.L. Sperr.

(1)
Hester Street, (running from fore to background), east from Essex, to Clinton Streets, showing (right), a portion of Seward Park and (left), the playground pf P.S. No. 62. Also shown are Nos. 18 to 30 Norfolk Street, at adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of Hester Street. The 2-story building at the corner, is the Hester Street branch of the N.Y. Edison Co.
April 25, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, another angle.

Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad A.R.P.S.
About 1936

(1)
Hester Street, (running from fore to background), east from Essex, to Clinton Streets, showing (right), a portion of Seward Park and (left), the playground pf P.S. No. 62. Also shown are Nos. 18 to 30 Norfolk Street, at adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of Hester Street. The 2-story building at the corner, is the Hester Street branch of the N.Y. Edison Co.
April 25, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
